    • Method Detail

      • requestTrade

        public java.lang.String requestTrade(java.lang.String traderId1,
                                     java.lang.String traderId2,
                                     java.util.Date meetingTime,
                                     java.util.Date secondMeetingTime,
                                     java.lang.String location,
                                     java.lang.String firstUserOfferId,
                                     java.lang.String secondUserOfferId,
                                     int allowedEdits,
                                     java.lang.String message)
                              throws UserNotFoundException,
                                     AuthorizationException,
                                     CannotTradeException
        Adds a new trade to the system and acknowledges that it is a requested trade between two users in the trade. A trade is a borrow if the the item the first user is offering is "". A trade is a lend if the item the second user is offering is "".
        Parameters:
        traderId1 - The id of the trader sending the trade
        traderId2 - The id of the trader receiving the trade
        meetingTime - The first meeting time for the trade
        secondMeetingTime - The second meeting time for the trade. Null for this means the trade is permanent
        location - The location the trade will occur
        firstUserOfferId - The trade sender's offer (empty string for trader1 to offer nothing)
        secondUserOfferId - The trade receiver's offer (empty string for trader2 to offer nothing)
        allowedEdits - The amount of times each trader can edit the trade
        message - The message that will be sent along with this trade
        Returns:
        the trade object's id
        Throws:
        UserNotFoundException - the user that wants to be traded with doesn't exist
        AuthorizationException - the item for trading cannot be traded
        CannotTradeException - cannot request a trade

      • acceptRequest

        public boolean acceptRequest(java.lang.String traderId,
                             java.lang.String tradeId)
                      throws TradeNotFoundException,
                             AuthorizationException,
                             UserNotFoundException,
                             CannotTradeException
        For accepting a trade request
        Parameters:
        traderId - the trader accepting the request
        tradeId - the trade id
        Returns:
        true if the request was accepted
        Throws:
        TradeNotFoundException - if the trade wasn't found
        AuthorizationException - if the user is not a trader
        UserNotFoundException - if the user doesn't exist
        CannotTradeException - if trading limitations prevent the trade from happening

      • confirmMeetingGeneral

        public void confirmMeetingGeneral(java.lang.String traderId,
                                  java.lang.String tradeId)
                           throws TradeNotFoundException,
                                  AuthorizationException,
                                  UserNotFoundException
        Confirms either the first or second meeting depending on which one is not confirmed. This method makes sure that the user can only confirm a second meeting once both traders have confirmed the first.
        Parameters:
        traderId - the trader confirming the meeting
        tradeId - id of the trade
        Throws:
        TradeNotFoundException - trade wasn't found
        AuthorizationException - this trade doesn't belong to this user
        UserNotFoundException - if the other user of the trade is not found

      • counterTradeOffer

        public java.lang.String counterTradeOffer(java.lang.String traderId,
                                          java.lang.String tradeId,
                                          java.util.Date meetingTime,
                                          java.util.Date secondMeetingTime,
                                          java.lang.String meetingLocation,
                                          java.lang.String thisTraderOffer,
                                          java.lang.String thatTraderOffer,
                                          java.lang.String message)
                                   throws CannotTradeException,
                                          TradeNotFoundException,
                                          AuthorizationException,
                                          UserNotFoundException
        Sending a counter offer
        Parameters:
        traderId - the trader id sending the counter offer
        tradeId - the trade id
        meetingTime - the new time of the trade
        secondMeetingTime - the second meeting time of the trade
        meetingLocation - the meeting location of the trade
        thisTraderOffer - the tradable item id that the current trader is offering
        thatTraderOffer - the tradable item id that the current trader wants from the other trader
        message - message of the offer
        Returns:
        the id of the trade
        Throws:
        CannotTradeException - too many edits
        TradeNotFoundException - this trade doesn't exist
        AuthorizationException - this trade doesn't belong to this user
        UserNotFoundException - user wasn't found

      • rescindTradeRequest

        public void rescindTradeRequest(java.lang.String tradeID)
                         throws TradeNotFoundException,
                                UserNotFoundException,
                                AuthorizationException
        Cancels a trade request
        Parameters:
        tradeID - The id of the trade request
        Throws:
        TradeNotFoundException - trade doesn't exist in the user's requested trades
        UserNotFoundException - the trader(s) can not be found
        AuthorizationException - couldn't find a trader type associated with the trade

      • rescindOngoingTrade

        public void rescindOngoingTrade(java.lang.String tradeID)
                         throws TradeNotFoundException,
                                UserNotFoundException,
                                AuthorizationException,
                                CannotTradeException
        Undos an ongoing, accepted trade by removing it from the databse and returning the items back to their respective users. This method only should be used carefully since rescinding an ongoing trade after the real life trade has happened has dire consequences.
        Parameters:
        tradeID - the id of the trade to undo
        Throws:
        TradeNotFoundException - trade doesn't exist in the user's accepted trades
        UserNotFoundException - the trader(s) can not be found
        AuthorizationException - couldn't find a trader type associated with the trade
        CannotTradeException - cannot complete this request because the trade could not be reversed
